clinical_study.brief_title: Ex Vivo Study of the Mechanism of Action of Active Ingredients on the Intestinal Microbiota
clinical_study.official_title: Stool Collection From Healthy Donors for the ex Vivo Study of the Mechanism of Action of Active Ingredients on the Intestinal Microbiota: Bacteria / Host Interaction Model

brief_summary.textblock: To design and understand the mechanism of action of different combinations of nutraceuticals coupling bacteria, fibers and polyphenols, which can act on the 4 pillars simultaneously via an innovative ex-vivo model approach coupled with functional and quantitative metagenomics.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of the study is to collect fresh stools from 4 healthy volunteers, in order to study the mechanism of action of probiotic strains, polyphenols and fibers, alone or in combinations. These fresh stools will be cultured in vitro in fermenters, and the samples taken at different culture times will be analyzed in terms of microbial composition (shotgun metagenomic analysis) and their cellular activity (functional metagenomic analysis).

primary_outcome.description: Change about the bacterial growth after 15 days of incubation
Change about the PH evolution after 15 days of incubation
Change about the quantity of Co2 production after 15 days of incubation

intervention.description: Fresh stools will be cultured in vitro in fermenters with adjunction of probiotic strains
Fresh stools will be cultured in vitro in fermenters with adjunction of polyphenols
Fresh stools will be cultured in vitro in fermenters with adjunction of fibers

study_pop.textblock: The research will be carried out on 4 healthy volunteers. The research will be carried out by the coordinating team of the INRAE MetaGenoPolis Unit.
